After fighting with DomainScope, DSF (max-docs-per-domain), and
SurtPrefixScope to get my desired crawl behavior (and speed), I
started working with DecidingScope, which definitly provides the most
flexibility.

That brings about my question.  It seems like SurtPrefixedDecideRule
could be extended with a max-docs-per-surt option?  Or would this need
to be an entirely seperate Rule?  Seems like this would carry through
to allow max-documents-per-surt, per-domain, per-host.

Guess you'd need a hash (memory or disk?) based on the SURT to track
doc counts for each surt?  The REJECT/ACCEPT conditions would then
have to be based SURT match and (max-documents-per-surt = 0 or
surt_count <= max-documents-per-surt)?
